text:
I frequently see this error, and nodesdk stops working (i.e. node process stops).
```  hfc Member.getNextTCert: key=null +0ms
  hfc Member.getNextTCert: key=null, creating new getter +0ms
  hfc shouldGetTCerts: yes, we have no tcerts +0ms
  hfc Warning: problem parsing certificate bytes; retrying ...  +37ms [Error: Wrong input string for convertion]
  <path>/node_modules/hfc/lib/hfc.js:2025
            throw Error('Failed fetching TCertBatch. No valid TCert received.');```

I see this error, when I invoke multiple transactions at the same time (load and stress testing so to speak). Is there anyway to work around this problem ? I'm using this environment:
 Hyperledger/fabric: v0.5.0-developerpreview
 Node SDK :  0.5.0 ( using npm package manager)

When I see "No valid TCert received", I also see this error in peer.
```2016/08/23 01:38:17 grpc: Server.Serve failed to create ServerTransport:  connection error: desc = "transport: write tcp 172.17.0.3:30303->172.17.0.1:33614: write: broken pipe"```
This happens when I run heavy stress test using Node.SDK.  And this is serious. *No transaction is carried out*.  So transactions are disappeared. Should I raise as "Issue" in Gerrit ?
